data.title: Star bowler lauds full team performance in strong U19WC win
data.body:
# Star bowler lauds full team performance in strong U19WC win

#### Wahid Zadran expresses his satisfaction as Afghanistan move to the top of Group D at the U19 World Cup.

### Broadcast details for ICC U19 Men's Cricket World Cup

Afghanistan excelled in all three key disciplines in their [dominant win against the West Indies](https://www.icc-cricket.com/tournaments/u19-cricket-worldcup-2026/news/england-afghanistan-pick-up-big-wins-in-u19-world-cup) at the ICC Under-19 Men's Cricket World Cup.

They took down the Caribbean side with relative ease, claiming a 138-run triumph in Namibia's capital, off the back of a strong batting display that yielded a 50-over total of 262/6.

Opener [Osman Sadat](https://www.icc-cricket.com/tournaments/u19-cricket-worldcup-2026/teams/1143/players/131958/osman-sadat) (88 off 131) and captain [Mahboob Khan](https://www.icc-cricket.com/tournaments/u19-cricket-worldcup-2026/teams/1143/players/121631/mahboob-khan) (86 off 69) were the key scoring contributions and the quality involvements continued when it was Afghanistan's time to field.

A statement win for Afghanistan | Match Highlights | U19 CWC 2026

Their opening bowlers delivered early, led by [Wahid Zadran](https://www.icc-cricket.com/tournaments/u19-cricket-worldcup-2026/teams/1143/players/115691/wahid-zadran)'s efforts, finishing with impressive figures of 3/36 off nine overs.

"It's always been a pleasure bowling good at the top of the Powerplay," Zadran said post-game.

"But the team ... I always (give the credit) to the team, the rest I don't care about. So it's very, very good (to get the win)."

The moment Afghanistan sealed their win over West Indies | U19 CWC 2026

Afghanistan displayed class in the field as well, which their star bowler was quick to point to.

"I give all the credit to (our fielders)," Zadran continued.

"We took some brilliant catches (and made) some brilliant stops, which gives the bowlers lots of confidence and lots of energy, so really happy and our fielders are doing well so far."

[INSTAGRAM:DTp8kArkqhQ]

While it was Osman Sadat that anchored their batting innings, skipper Mahboob's aggressive 86 went a long way to inspiring the rest of the team at Namibia's High Performance Oval in Windhoek.

"(Mahboob) is (very) responsible for the team ... he's also the keeper and he (was) leading from the front today," Zadran said.

"He did really well, so that was the reason we did really well and we won.

"(The openers did) so well. When the team starts well, it's going well for (everyone) ... then in the middle, (Mahboob) played very well, so the total was very fair and went very well for us, so we bowled with confidence and (were) very good, so (overall) we were so happy.

A captain's knock from Mahboob | POTM Highlights | U19 CWC 2026

"It was a day that made history, looking forward, because in cricket, every day's a new day ... we just want to take the momentum of today to the (next) game."

Afghanistan now sit clear at the top of Group D, dreaming big at the World Cup. They will look to remain unbeaten ahead of the Super Six stage when they take on [Tanzania in Namibia on Wednesday](https://www.icc-cricket.com/tournaments/u19-cricket-worldcup-2026/matches/267852/afghanistan-under-19-vs-tanzania-under-19).

data.title: Beardman, Edwards included for Pakistan T20Is; Maxwell, Ellis rested
data.body:
# Beardman, Edwards included for Pakistan T20Is; Maxwell, Ellis rested

Ten players who are in Australia's T20 World Cup squad will be part of the three-match series in Pakistan

Jack Edwards has been in the wickets for Sydney Sixers  â€¢  Getty Images

[Mahli Beardman](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/mahli-beardman-1393948) and [Jack Edwards](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/jack-edwards-1088610) could make their international debuts against Pakistan after being included in [Australia](https://www.espncricinfo.com/team/australia-2)'s squad for the three T20Is which act as a lead-up to the next month's World Cup.

Beardman, the 20-year pace bowler, and allrounder Edwards have been named following impressive [BBL](https://www.espncricinfo.com/series/bangladesh-premier-league-2025-26-1516530) campaigns for Perth Scorchers and Sydney Sixers respectively. Beardman was part of the T20I squad against India earlier this season while Edwards was briefly part of the ODI group.

Ten of Australia's T20 World Cup will be part of the Pakistan trip. [Glenn Maxwell](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/glenn-maxwell-325026) and [Nathan Ellis](https://www.espncricinfo.com/cricketers/nathan-ellis-826915) will be rested for a brief period after the BBL while Tim David, Josh Hazlewood and Pat Cummins are continuing their returns from injury.

Alongside Beardman and Edwards, Sean Abbott, Ben Dwarshuis, Mitch Owen, Josh Phillippe and Matt Renshaw come into the 17-player squad.

"The series is a great opportunity for those on the brink of selection and some young players we rate highly for valuable experience with the World Cup group in Pakistan," chair of selectors George Bailey said.

"Some are already experienced international players along with Mahli Beardman who has been with the group a number of times and Jack Edwards who joined for the last one-day match against India in Sydney last year."

Players competing in the remainder of the BBL will join the squad in Pakistan once their tournament is complete. Australia are due to play three T20Is in Lahore between January 29 and February 1. Their first game of the T20 World Cup is on February 11, in Colombo against Ireland.

Australia squad vs Pakistan

Mitchell Marsh (capt), Sean Abbott, Xavier Bartlett, Mahli Beardman, Cooper Connolly, Ben Dwarshuis, Jack Edwards, Cameron Green, Travis Head, Josh Inglis, Matthew Kuhnemann, Mitch Owen, Josh Philippe, Matthew Renshaw, Matthew Short, Marcus Stoinis, Adam Zampa
